metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: This section explains how to use conditional statements in Bash scripting.
content.html: This section explains how to use conditional statements in Bash scripting.

content.text: If statements allow you to execute code based on a condition. If the condition is true, the code block will run.
content.html: If statements allow you to execute code based on a condition. If the condition is true, the code block will run.

content.text: The condition is enclosed in square brackets [ ] and the statement ends with fi , which is if spelled backward, marking the end of the if block.
content.html: The condition is enclosed in square brackets [ ] and the statement ends with fi, which is if spelled backward, marking the end of the if block.

content.code:
# Basic if statement


num
=
15


if

[

$num
-gt
10

]
;

then


echo

"Number is greater than 10"


fi
content.code_html:
# Basic if statement
num=15
if [ $num -gt 10 ]; then
  echo "Number is greater than 10"
fi

content.text: If...else statements provide a way to execute one block of code if a condition is true and another block if it is false.
content.html: If...else statements provide a way to execute one block of code if a condition is true and another block if it is false.

content.text: The else keyword introduces the alternative block, and the statement ends with fi .
content.html: The else keyword introduces the alternative block, and the statement ends with fi.

content.code:
# If...else statement


num
=
8


if

[

$num
-gt
10

]
;

then


echo

"Number is greater than 10"


else


echo

"Number is 10 or less"


fi
content.code_html:
# If...else statement
num=8
if [ $num -gt 10 ]; then
  echo "Number is greater than 10"
else
  echo "Number is 10 or less"
fi

content.text: Elif statements allow you to check multiple conditions in sequence. If the first condition is false, the next one is checked.
content.html: Elif statements allow you to check multiple conditions in sequence. If the first condition is false, the next one is checked.

content.text: The elif keyword stands for "else if," and the statement still ends with fi .
content.html: The elif keyword stands for "else if," and the statement still ends with fi.

content.code:
# If...elif...else statement


num
=
10


if

[

$num
-gt
10

]
;

then


echo

"Number is greater than 10"


elif

[

$num
-eq
10

]
;

then


echo

"Number is exactly 10"


else


echo

"Number is less than 10"


fi
content.code_html:
# If...elif...else statement
num=10
if [ $num -gt 10 ]; then
  echo "Number is greater than 10"
elif [ $num -eq 10 ]; then
  echo "Number is exactly 10"
else
  echo "Number is less than 10"
fi

content.text: Nested if statements allow you to place an if statement inside another if statement, enabling more complex logic.
content.html: Nested if statements allow you to place an if statement inside another if statement, enabling more complex logic.

content.text: Each if block must be closed with its own fi .
content.html: Each if block must be closed with its own fi.

content.code:
# Nested if statement


num
=
5


if

[

$num
-gt
0

]
;

then


if

[

$num
-lt
10

]
;

then


echo

"Number is between 1 and 9"


fi


fi
content.code_html:
# Nested if statement
num=5
if [ $num -gt 0 ]; then
  if [ $num -lt 10 ]; then
    echo "Number is between 1 and 9"
  fi
fi
